result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph D Marion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: case 15CM3707 and with any other sentence.    Huber release privileges for work only.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and disbursements by January 5, 2017. Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the costs, successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law rising to the level of probable cause.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph D Marion

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to case #15CM3707 and to any other sentence, with credit for 2 (two) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work ONLY:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
   
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, surcharges and disbursements by January 5, 2017. 
          Any remaining balance will be due immediately or an entry of
          a civil judgment.
  .
Court will consider motion for expungement if defendant pays the fine and costs successfully completes the sentence and has no further violations of the law raising to the level of probable cause.
.
-20 day appeal given,

 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing, motion hearing withdrawn prior. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.  Case calendared for status conference.
For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37. Court ordered defense motion be due by 11/6/15 and state's reply due by 11/25/15.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court prior to case being called with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing. Defense counsel is awaiting discovery. For reasons stated on the record as to defense leaving public defender's office.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing. Defense counsel needs more time, follow-up with State on additional discovery. Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
-Motion To Adjourn Hearing from Attorney T.R. Williams on behalf of her client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
-Motion To Adjourn Hearing from Attorney T.R. Williams on behalf of her client; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court pro-se.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant may be public defender eligbible, due to unemployment. 

-CASE PASSED
-CASE RECALLED AT 3:07 P.M.
-BRITTANY SKYE KACHINGWE appeared for the State of Wisconsin and T.R. Williams. Defendant public defender eligible, defense counsel requests motion hearing.
Any and all motions are to be filed with the court 4 weeks prior to motion hearing date. State's response: 2 weeks prior to motion hearing date.   Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The remaining bail is to be returned to the remitter. 
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph D Marion in court.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 37  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/15/15 @ 1:30 pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
12-17-2014
